verses.roman:
athāpy āśrāvaye brahma
nara-loka-viḍambanam
rājñaḥ paitṛ-ṣvasreyasya
bhaktasya ca cikīrṣitam

synonyms: atha api—nonetheless; āśrāvaye—I shall tell; brahma—O Supreme Truth; nara-loka—of human society; viḍambanam—(to You) who imitate; rājñaḥ—of the King (Yudhiṣṭhira); paitṛ—of Your father; svasreyasya—of the sister's son; bhaktasya—Your devotee; ca—and; cikīrṣitam—the intentions.
translation: Nonetheless, O Supreme Truth playing the part of a human being, I shall tell You what Your devotee Yudhiṣṭhira Mahārāja, the son of Your father's sister, intends to do.
